replies.bodyText: There is no callback in shutdown(). The callback that you added this comment to is fine because I changed it to check for current state RUNNING. When shutdown() is called the state is STOPPING.

timeline.bodyText: My PR https://github.com/aws/aws-greengrass-kernel/pull/189/files was trying to solve the same issue. My approach is to block the loop until a valid new desired state appears, so that we don't enter the same loop twice. I personally feel creating a hard-coded variable for this is confusing. We can discuss about this

replies.bodyText: That's fine, I just needed a fix to pass tests. We can solve it better with your PR, but unless that is being merged soon, we need a fix for this stuff ASAP.
